Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: milsher
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights. The location couldn't be better! The room is not very big, but decorated nicely. The price for the breakfast is 19€ online, but when I checked in they offered it to me for 12. That's a good deal - it's a really nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaCurli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in mid-March. We were pleasantly surprised by how wonderful this hotel proved to be. We booked a premium room and it was worth the money. The room is nice, the bathroom and shower were great and the amenities were better than most other hotels. The buffet breakfast was extensive, very well staffed and even offered brownies. Our only complaint was that the beds are a little hard but that seems to be the case for Spain. It was convenient to walk to many of the sights of Madrid and the metro. There are numerous tappas bars in the neighborhood. It was very quiet for any light sleepers out there. When we return to Madrid, we will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: NaplesFloridaJfk
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights.Used as a base to do day trips to Toledo and Segovia. Walking distance to the Prado ,Plaza Mayor,train station and airport bus.Metro very close. Very friendly staff.Nice price.Upgraded room facing main street.Big bathroom with window.No tub but nice rain shower. Would recommend and would stay again for sure. Did not eat breakfast in hotel.Cafe across street is called Peter Pan,good for coffee and pastry

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Modern and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kirby003
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived by Airport Bus to Puerta de Atocha train station (30 minute ride for 2 euros per person), which is three Metro stops away from this hotel (Anton Martin). We decided to walk with our luggage which is about a 10 minute walk. However, note that Calle de Atocha is slightly uphill. The concierge staff is very helpful and multilingual. We were able to check in and enter our room earlier than the designated check-in times. We were given a 5th floor room towards the back of the hotel and it was one of the most spacious hotel rooms we've stayed in in London/Paris/Barcelona. Modern amenities, very clean, hardwood floors and free WiFi. The location of the hotel is close to Retiro Park, Prado Museum, Plaza Mayor, Mercato de San Miguel, etc. All within a 15 minute walk. There are several banks within steps of the hotel for ATM transactions as well as very good places to get coffee, fresh orange juice, churros with chocolate in the morning. We opted not for the hotel buffet breakfast. My wife inadvertently left her sunglasses when we checked out for a 3 day trip to Sevilla. We called them and the hotel staff was very helpful. We were able to retrieve them without any issues when we returned to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: tech420
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights and we could not fault the hotel or staff . Lovely modern hotel in easy walking distance of most of the sights you will want to see, great breakfast, free wifi and If you are really keen there is a small but well equiped gym downstairs The hotel is on a busy main road,don't really know if its a problem as we requested a quite room which is what we got. Loads of bars nearby just cross the road turn right and first left and left again (about 75m total) our fav's two great bars jazz and cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable modern hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cem76
Reviews.Content: We stayed seven nights at this hotel and were very, very happy with our choice. To echo what many others have said: Location - perfect! Easy walking distance of just about everything a tourist wants to do in Madrid: all the museums, Plaza Mayor (starting point for many tours), the train station (take it to visit Toledo), the bus station (take it to visit Segovia, though this is a bit farther of a walk, about 2.5 kilometers, I believe), the Palace, La Latina (popular tapas district)... and Plaza Santa Ana is just steps away, providing a really wonderful place to eat any time. Rooms - also perfect! Modern, sleek design. Wood floors. We had a first floor room on the street side, so I was a little worried that it could be noisy, but it was not! The glass windows and doors are double-paned and we had complete silence (and darkness, thanks to high quality drapes) whenever we wanted to sleep, regardless of how many people or cars were on the street outside. Bathrooms are very large. Agree with other reviewers that there's a bit less privacy than some rooms, because the bathroom doors are frosted glass, but you couldn't see in or out. We wish they would put kettles in the rooms for hot water, but the staff was very accommodating and brought us a carafe of hot water when we needed it. (We bought a cup of coffee at the same time, but I assume they would do this even if we had not purchased the coffee.) Service was great. Everything was sparkling clean and everyone was happy to help. Gym is pretty small and sparse -- just some cardio machines (bikes, a rower, and an elliptical, I think), but space on the floor to use for yoga or ab work or whatever. Fyi -- hot tub is broken and it's not clear when it will be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: MarkWijman
Reviews.Content: Good location within walking distance of all museums you want to go and see (Prado, Thyssen, Caixa Forum) - nice restaurants nearby (santa ana) just a few steps from public transport (Anton Martin) brand new (open 1 week open) hotel. Large rooms, nice bathing room with amenities, great beds. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for the weekend as a good base to sightsee Madrid. Was very impressed. The room was modern, clean and comfortable, and the staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English. The hotel is ideally placed to see Madrid, a short walk one way to the Plaza Mayor (and the wonderful 'Mercato de san Miguel' market), and a short walk the other way to the Prado and Botanical Gardens. Also very close to the Calle de las Huertas, whioch is full of great little bars which come alive after 22:00. The hotel offers free wifi which was very useful. However I wouldn't bother ordering breakfast (which is extra), as there is a great little cafe literally opposite the hotel which does a lovely breakfast for less. Also worth shopping around before you book, as you can get some great deals on room prices for this hotel online. Overall, I would strongly recommend this hotel, and will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, great rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: EricGu
Reviews.Content: I stayed with friends at Hotel Catalonia Plaza Mayor for 2 nights at the end of our road trip in South of Spain. We were 4 and therefore we booked 2 rooms. We had the chance to get upgraded on both rooms :-) Rooms were great. They were spatious, nicely decorated, with good sound isolation. We basically could not hear anything from the street even if were on the 1st and 2nd floor right above the street. The shower was really nice. It is very clear that the hotel is new (a few months old according to hotel staff). There was free wifi. It worked with my ipad and with my laptop, but unfortunately it did not work with my smartphone because of the authentication mechanism used. They had a special offer for breakfast at 10 Euros. I had it once and this was a good deal. The location of the hotel is very good. This walking distance from the "main attractions". Overall, we were very happy with the hotel and our stay, especially for the price we paid. I recommend this hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Front Staff Could Improve”
Reviews.Author: larover
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in very good condition in a convenient part of Madrid. Front staff attempt to be helpful and are very polite. However their knowledge of the immediate area is not very good. They sent us to an absolutely vile restaurant. We did much better on our own and with trip advisor restaurant reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: sxd9mm
Reviews.Content: Great helpfull staff, close to everything (sites, train station, major streets/plazas, etc.). All facilities in great condition. WiFi. Can't go wrong with.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: lavellejohn
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night break in this hotel over the new year. A group of 18 of us stayed for 3 nights from the 30/12 - 02/01. We had about 8/9 rooms booked for our stay ranging from €131 - €220 per room per night. This hotel is in a great location, it is very modern and clean. The staff from reception to housekeeping were extremely helpful and friendly. Only one little issue we had was the bathroom doors. They are frosted glass except for the hotel logo part which is fully see through. Also ALL of our rooms had large gaps between the bathroom door and the frame and lying in bed you could see someone sitting on the toilet. This for us was hilarious but I can see some people finding it disturbing!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, helpful staff, fair price”
Reviews.Author: albwilson
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 9AM after an all-night flight. Since they had an unsused room they were happy to let us go to it immediately at no extra charge. The straff continued to be helpfull all through the stay. The hotel is within walking distance of the museums (prado, Reina Sofia and Thyssen Bornemiza). Also within walking distance of Plaza Mayor, Atocha train station and subway. There's a great pastry shop right across the street for breakfast. Don't spend the money for the hotel's breakfast. Great deal getting in from the airport: use the big yellow EMT bus. Two euros each to get to the Atocha train station. Then catch a cab to your hotel. Big savings over getting a cab to twon from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “You won't get wrong with Catalonia chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanpradja
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Catalonia Port Barcelona 2 years ago, it was a fabulous experience so that I chose this chain hotel again when I stayed in Madrid. What I love about this chain hotel is their hotels always in the central of the city and they have spacious modern rooms. The hotel's rate is also a plus point since the price is so affordable for a 4 star hotel (EUR 80 per night for a double occupancy). My room did not come with the breakfast, but there are many coffee shops around this hotel, (actually there is a very good one right in front of this hotel). When we arrived, I asked the reception if they have a business center since my friend forgot to print her boarding pass, and they said that she could just sent them the email and they will print it, for free! In fact, my friend even used their computer there and directly printed her boarding pass. The wi-fi connection in the room is also a big advantage. This hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful”
Reviews.Author: tarzanldy
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel in a fabulous location, equal distance (opposite directions) to the 3 top museums and Plaza Mayor. We spent two nights and had a double room with breakfast included. At check-in we were offered an upgrade to the superior room for an extra 40 euro per night. So glad we didn't as our room was large and had great amenities including a towel warmer. Breakfast was a buffet filled with anything you could possibly want and then some. Our last day we had to leave before breakfast, but they graciously packed us a "picnic" so that we didn't leave hungry. The only suggestion I would offer is that they have coffee service in the lobby for those of us wake hours before breakfast opened.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location – almost ticked all the boxes!”
Reviews.Author: KeenHolidayFan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location for Madrid sightseeing and close to the many restaurants and tapas bars of Plaza de Santa Ana. It had a complete renovation just over 6 months ago so the interior has a very fresh and modern appearance. The room we had wasn’t overly large but was well set out, the bed was extremely comfortable and the shower powerful. It overlooked the inner courtyard so was very quiet. The only problem was that the room was so dark, lit by a series of little spot lights that where impossible to apply my make-up under. There was a sort of dressing table, but the TV was positioned over this, the mirror was alongside the bed so to enable me to style my hair I had to unplug one of the valued bedside lights so I could plug in my straighteners and sit on the floor to style. Apart from this I would recommend this hotel. All the staff we spoke to were extremely friendly and helpful. On arrival the receptionist gave us a map and highlighted places that he thought would be of interest. We arrived at 10 pm and asked if he could recommend a place to eat, the tapas bar/restaurant was perfect for first night fuelling –in fact we returned there again another night. We didn’t have breakfast in the hotel as it seemed expensive; we didn’t need to as there was a fantastic bakery/café over the road that offered a breakfast deal of coffee, juice and a large pastry for €3.25, but other choices were endless and are making me hungry thinking about it now! Another plus for this hotel is that, if possible, they offer a late room checkout; until 3pm for €30 and until 6pm for €40 – as our return flight was at 9.50pm we took advantage of this.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Refurbished for Style and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Visphot
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Catalonia Plaza Mayor seems to have been newly refurbished and is both stylish and comfortable. The hotel is well located relative to Atocha RENFE and even closer to the nearest metro station. There are plenty of places to eat just around the corner and Plaza Mayor is not too far either. What we liked best about the hotel was the pleasant nature of the front office staff. We interacted frequently with Xavier and Rosa during our 5-day stay and found both to be very fluent in English and cheerfully helpful. The bell-boys were more active and available than in any of the five hotels we used on this trip. The modern decor of the room is pleasing though the design of the bathroom door (not fully fitting / sealing at the edges) might not please everyone. The bedroom and bathroom fittings were of a uniformly high standard. There were, however, no facilities for making tea or coffee in the room. A very pleasant hotel which we would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OrlyE
Reviews.Content: A great city center hotel. Business enviornement more for business and families less for for romantic get away. Pluses: 1) New 2) Great Location - 5 min. walk from everything 3) Great Service

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a Great location”
Reviews.Author: ekehat
Reviews.Content: The location is superb. Everything is within a short walking distance. There's a nice bakery just across the street so you may want to skip the pricey hotel breakfast in favor of their much better deal. Our room was large and modern. Too bad that there was no bath tub (only a shower) and that the bathroom door doesn't actually close and give you privecy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms, great service & location”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler919
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 3 nights in late September and we were both pleasantly surprised and pleased with it. First of all it's in the best location - near Plaza Mayor, Santa Ana, Puerta del Sol, so everything was within less than 10 minutes walking distance and no time or money was wasted. Museums, restaurants, bars, shopping are all easily accessible from the hotel as is the metro which was about a block or two away. Great cafes nearby including a fantastic pastry shop directly across from the hotel. Rooms were spotless, spacious, bright and clean with nice modern touch as were the bathrooms. We were given a smokers room as there were no nonsmoking rooms available but you wouldn't have known it walking in to our room as the hotel is fairly new. Staff was super nice, accommodating and helpful as we regularly inquired about directions, restaurants, sites, etc. Rooms had wifi but no business center or computer access at the hotel but they did direct me to a great internet cafe 2 blocks away. Highly recommend and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MiriGalway_Ireland
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and myself stayed in this hotel for three nights in early September. It is a great hotel in a great location. Staff were friendly and helpful. Hotel is modern and clean and the location could not be better, it is not far from the metro and from Plaza Mayor and Plaza St.Ana. Would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 star hotel in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ibabovic
Reviews.Content: Very clean and modern hotel in the heart of Madrid. Staff pleasant and multilingual. Less than a kilometer away from the Atocha Renfe station on one end and Plaza Mayor on the other (10 min walk), 10th mins also from Puerta del Sol, where you can catch city tour buses. Right across the hotel is a cheap and good bakery "Peter Pan", where breakfast is much cheaper than in the hotel. Rooms are air-conditioned (only down point is the ac blows directly on the bed so eyes get dry fast when watching tv). Highly recommended, will post pictures later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: SpencerTracy
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel. It's located in the heart of Madrid, basically a 10 minute stroll from the Plaza Mayor and the Puerta del Sol. Metro is about 100m from the door, to the right. The Atocha train station is, I believe, only a couple of metro stops further along or about .5 kms walking. This is perfect if you are coming into Madrid on the high speed AVE train or are coming in from Barajas on the yellow bus (2€ ). Both will leave you right there at Atocha. The hotel itself seems to be new. Modern, minimalist. I read one comment of someone having problem with cleanliness. I had no such problem but I am sure staff can miss something on occasion. Some guests can be pigs. Service was very correct, staff friendly. As I like news, I appreciated the news/business channels. There were various channels in a number of languages. In English, they had CNBC, Bloomberg, CNN, and BBC World. FREE internet in the rooms, too!! They give you the pw at check-in. That's about all I know. Good restaurants and bars to be had either down on Lope de Vega street or up in La Latina neighborhood, just off the Plaza Mayor. Enjoy your visit! Madrid is a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - would recommend to friends”
Reviews.Author: ZhannaL
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff and new modern rooms with excellent bathrooms. Great towels and pillows. So comfy... We did not take breakfast at the hotel, but there are so many options outside. Loved how the hotel preserved the stairs and the little courtyards in the original style.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyCepeda
Reviews.Content: Rooms of excelent quality. Magnificent shower (baño español), plasma TV wooden floors. Totally renovated. Poor restaurant facilities but just in front of the hotel, across the street you will find a nice cafeteria for breakfast. Does not have a parking lot, so you will have to walk five blocks to park a rent a car, at the nearest parking lot. There is no SPA, it is just people comming to your room to offer a massage.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: annayblacky
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! Modern, just opened. Walking distance from all major plazas and nightlife. A must if you want to enjoy madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: squal_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, renovated a few years ago, large and clean room with great design. We got a room in the back of the hotel, very quiet. The hotel stands a few hundred meters of Santa Ana Plaza. Free WiFi available.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful find in lovely Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Kajohn1011
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful new hotel in excellent location in Madrid. Spent three nights here....two at the beginning of a 10 day trip to Spain and Portugal and one the night before we returned home. The hotel is extremely quiet, with wonderful beds and linens, beautiful modern new furniture with a minimalist touch....unbelievably comfortable. The staff is superb and their helpfulness was greatly appreciated. Lovely bar and sitting area in a courtyard.Across the street from outstanding patisserie. Short walk to Plaza Mayor and San Miguel Market. Loved everything about this hotel for a European vacation!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Catalonia Plaza Mayor
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Atocha 36, 28012 Madrid, Spain
